Posts.Content: Immediate n/v is not uncommon after even the first Chemo Tx.  Sounds like your a good friend good luck to you both- I myself was an oncology nurse, now o.r, now cancer patient starting my chemo in a few weeks.
Posts.Title: Nausea and vomiting on the first day?

Posts.Content: Thank God!! Good luck and praying for a uneventful long recovery.
Posts.Title: good news

Posts.Content: I am an O.R. nurse, you need to get a copy of your medical record. This is the only way to definitively know what was given to you.  Many different drugs can be used at that stage. Good luck.  Trish
Posts.Title: Anesthisia

Posts.Content: On Nov 21, 2009 10:23 PM atomicjoy wrote: On Nov 20, 2009 1:53 PM Hopeful30 wrote: Hi there, I had a unilateral mastecomy with immediate DIEP flap reconstruction.    It is a difficult surgery with a long recovery (4-6) weeks, but I am very happy with my results -- although it took some time --   I would do it again.  Personally, I did not wannt a foreign object (implant) in me -- would make me worry. active and there are lots of women with experience of both implants and flaps.   Post under the Reconstruction Thread and you will get lots of feedback. Hello, I had a doublemastectomy and DIEP flap reconstruction at BIDMC in Boston.  My surgeon was excellent.  He is at www.bostondiep.com "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.bostondiep.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">www.bostondiep.com   I don't know if you're near Boston but if you are it would be worth it to check it out.  DIEP recon. is major surgery (12 hours) because it is microsurgery BUT you only have to do it once if you have a double mastectomy.  I did not want implants because I was told that they don't last forever and eventually you have to have them replaced.  I'm in my 40's and I could not picture myself having that type of surgery again when I was in my 60's or 70's because I don't think I'd recover as quickly.  But that just my opinion.  I do know others that have had implants and they love them.   Atomicjoy I had a mastectomy and tramflap two weeks ago and still am using pain meds, is that normal?? I feel I can do more while on the meds, trust me not a lot just getting around the house.
Posts.Title: implants or flap reconstruction

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy with a tramflap two weeks ago, painful yes, but worth it .  I still have reconstruction to undergo in two weeks to make the left side more symmetrical and debride some of the tissue.  For me it gives me a more natural feeling and I got rid of my tummy, I'll take anything at this point to help me feel better about myself. Good luck!
Posts.Title: implants or flap reconstruction

Posts.Content: On Oct 09, 2009 12:00 AM tony928 wrote: I am a 47 yr old male. who has dropped 49lbs in 6months without trying. I have had nipple discharge, body pet scan which showed lumps underneath arms, lymph nodes swollen on throat, neck etc.. They did a prolactin test which is negative. WBC count goes up and down, did not do a CEA test yet. had a mamogram 2years ago showed lumps but didn't do anything. I cannot get any answers all tests come back normal, but I know something is wrong, I am eating more than I have ever eatten and still losing weight, all is ok but have not tested for CEA . Can anyone relate and have any suggestions for me. thanks tony Tony, A breast biopsy is indicated with the nipple discharge and swollen lymph nodes.  The weight loss is of great concern.  You need to get a full work up, PET scan,abd/pelvic Get it all done, your symptoms are demanding this workup! Good luck Trish
Posts.Title: not getting answers
